results.title: Progress on Child Poverty, but ‘Families Are Still Struggling’
results.abstract: A decline in child poverty, but risks ahead. Also: Close Gitmo; Republicans and a new constitution; a second kitchen; going back to the movies.

multimedia.caption: Ruth Raudales, a single mother who works part time and attends college, said food aid for her son has both economic and psychological benefits. “Now it’s like if something happens, we’ll be OK,” she said.

results.title: Are There Better Places to Put Large Solar Farms Than These Forests?
results.abstract: For the great promise of renewable energy to be realized, states like Virginia must create an environment where solar, nature and people can peaceably coexist.

results.title: ‘We Can’t Let the Kids Go Outdoors’: Our New Reality on the West Coast
results.abstract: For children there, it isn’t a question of what you want to do outside; it’s whether it is even safe to leave the house.

results.abstract: In the midst of a debate about the content being presented in America’s schools, the equally pressing issue of how teachers teach is in danger of being lost.

results.title: Inside the Completely Legal G.O.P. Plot to Destroy American Democracy
results.abstract: Imagine a legal January 6. It’s bureaucratic, boring, invisible, and it might actually succeed.
